title: Despite red flags, Karnataka grants Bengaluru land worth Rs 255 crore to 22 Dalit & OBC mutts
description: In a bold move, the Karnataka government has earmarked a staggering 255 crore rupees in Bengaluru land for 22 Dalit and OBC mutts, dismissing departmental warnings regarding the allocation of protected gomala land within the city. Senior ministers brushed aside concerns raised by the finance and law departments about potential legal implications, asserting these were mere procedural hurdles.

title: Delhi Confidential: Polite Reminder
Noida techie death: The road that ended in a tragedy
description: On a dark fog-ridden January night in Greater Noida, a water-filled construction pit — unmarked and unfenced — became a fatal trap. Yuvraj Mehta, a 27-year-old techie, accidentally drove into it and died. The incident has become more than a personal tragedy, turning into an indictment of a city built — and sold — faster than ground realities can keep pace, finds Shrimansi Kaushik. Residents say neglect and institutional apathy have turned urban spaces into landscapes of loss

title: Ashok Chakra a collective blessing frompeople of India, says Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla
description: Receiving the Ashok Chakra, India's premier peacetime military distinction, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla perceives this honor as a shared tribute from a grateful nation. Overflowing with gratitude and a renewed determination, he pledged to push the boundaries of India's innovative space endeavors.

This comes as the board also grapples with the team's exclusion from the T20 World Cup due to security concerns in India. Shakib, who had faced public anger, expressed openness to reversing his decision.

title: Relevance of acharyas
Bangladesh: Hindu mechanic burnt to death in his workshop
description: A 23-year-old Hindu mechanic, Chanchal Chandra Bhowmik, was tragically burnt alive in his Narsingdi workshop after it was deliberately set ablaze while he slept. Despite assurances of minority protection, this planned arson, captured on CCTV, saw Chanchal trapped and unable to escape the flames. Police are investigating and forming a team to apprehend the perpetrators.

title: Next generation should protect Tamil culture, learn traditional music, dance, says Muruganandam
Body found by cops not that of wife, man acquitted after 8 years
description: A man jailed for eight years for his wife's murder has been acquitted. The court found critical flaws, including doubts about the recovered body's identity and a lack of established motive. The prosecution's case, built on circumstantial evidence, failed to form an unbroken chain pointing solely to the accused, leading to his immediate release.

title: Magistrate cannot be a judge in his own cause: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that a judge cannot preside over a case involving themselves, quashing proceedings against a railway official. A special railway magistrate had initiated action against the administration for insufficient staff, claiming interference. However, the apex court found the magistrate attempting to judge his own cause, ending the judicial-railway dispute.

title: ‘Bhajan-clubbing’ no less than global concerts, says PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Modi lauded the youth's 'bhajan-clubbing' trend, a modern fusion of devotion and culture resonating with Gen Z, comparing it to global concerts. He also highlighted Malaysia's Tamil schools, the UAE's 'Year of the Family', and urged a national focus on manufacturing excellence, declaring the 'chalta hai' attitude obsolete.

title: Indian-origin man shot dead in Canada, police suspect targeted gang-linked attack
description: Police said Gill was known to them, and the shooting “appears to have a nexus to the British Columbia Gang conflict”; Shortly after the shooting, police located a vehicle engulfed in flames in Buxton Street.

title: H-1B visa interview slots unavailable across India; new dates pushed to 2027
description: Indian professionals face significant H-1B visa disruptions as new stamping dates are unavailable this year, with interviews deferred to 2027. US consulates in India report no regular slots, and experts see no immediate improvement. Stricter US visa policies, including social media screening and a ban on third-country stamping, are contributing to the severe delays and visa revocations.

title: Experts highlight evolving career pathways in biotechnology
description: Careers in biotechnology are shaped by human-centric innovation, sustainability, and interdisciplinary skills, say speakers at webinar on ‘Careers in Biotechnology: What you need to know’

title: 'Leveraging complementary strengths': Von der Leyen highlights strategic India-EU partnership
description: India and the EU are forging a strategic partnership at a crucial summit, aiming for a landmark Free Trade Agreement and a game-changing security and defence pact. Discussions also cover mobility, technology, and a joint agenda for prosperity and global issues, signaling a united front in a complex world.

title: U.S. judge blocks Trump administration's push to end legal status of 8,400 migrants
description: Under the family reunification programs, U.S. citizens or lawful permanent residents, also known as green card holders, could apply to ⁠serve as sponsors for family members in those seven countries, letting them live in the U.S. while they waited for their immigrant visas to become available.

title: ‘Because she has an accent…’: Indian‑origin doctor says her mother was ‘harassed’ by ICE agents in Texas
description: In a chilling episode, an Indian-American physician recounted her aged mother's harrowing run-in with ICE officers while shopping in a Texas mall. The agents suspiciously interrogated her about her heritage, mistakenly assuming she was a Spanish speaker, only to backtrack when she confirmed her citizenship.

title: Drake Maye steals hearts with pregame gesture for wife Ann Michael
description: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye's heartwarming pre-game kiss with his wife, Ann Michael, before the AFC Championship game has captivated fans. Their long-standing relationship, dating back to middle school, adds a romantic touch to their NFL journey. Ann Michael's own social media popularity further endears the couple to the public, highlighting a sweet blend of sports and personal connection.

title: Jammu and Kashmir CM asks people to avoid non-essential travel for 3 days amid snowfall forecast

title: 15km in 10 hours: Snow rush turns into traffic nightmare in Manali
description: Thousands of tourists were stranded in Manali for a second day due to icy roads and a massive traffic surge. Exit routes saw jams exceeding 10km, forcing tourists to walk on ice in sub-zero temperatures. Many spent the night shivering in vehicles, describing the ordeal as nightmarish.

title: Did Cardi B name her son 'Touchdown'? Viral photo has fans buzzing
description: Rapper Cardi B sparked online  chaos with a playful response to fan speculation about her son's name. A simple photo caption led to widespread guessing. Cardi B then humorously clarified that the child in the picture was Wavey (son with Offset). She also teased fans about another child, referencing a rumored name.

Former BCCI president IS Bindra passes away at 84
description: Former BCCI president and veteran cricket administrator Inderjit Singh Bindra passed away at his New Delhi residence on Sunday at the age of 84. His health deteriorated suddenly after lunch, and he died around 6.30 pm. The last rites of Bindra, a key figure in Indian cricket administration, will be performed at the Lodhi crematorium on Monday.

This evolving destination aims to engage all ages.

This aggressive batting display signals a new era for Indian T20 cricket.

description: India crushed New Zealand by eight wickets in the third T20I to seal the series 3-0. Bumrah’s 3/17, backed by Hardik, Bishnoi, and Rana, restricted New Zealand to 153/9. In reply, Abhishek Sharma’s 68 off 20 and Suryakumar Yadav’s 57 off 26 powered India to 155/2 in just 10 overs, completing a commanding win.

Abhishek Sharma scripts history with fastest-ever fifty vs New Zealand, joins elite club
description: Abhishek Sharma etched his name in the record books with a blistering 14-ball fifty, the joint third-fastest in men's T20Is against a Full Member nation. His fearless counter-attack, including a rapid 53-run partnership with Ishan Kishan, set the tone for India's comfortable chase. This historic knock followed a mixed series start, showcasing Sharma's growing reputation as a formidable top-order batter.

title: Cruz says Navarro, Vance blocked India trade deal; mocks Trump tariffs in leaked audio
description: Senator Ted Cruz was secretly recorded criticizing Vice President JD Vance and mocking President Trump's tariff policy. Cruz warned donors that the tariffs could harm the economy and lead to Trump's impeachment, recounting a heated call with the President. He also accused Vance of being a protégé of Tucker Carlson, influencing foreign policy appointments.

'Inconsistency is permanent': Samson's golden duck triggers flood of fan reactions
description: Sanju Samson's T20I struggles persisted as he was dismissed for a golden duck on the first ball against New Zealand. His recent lean patch, with scores of 10, 6, and 0, has intensified discussions about India's opening combination. Meanwhile, India's bowlers, led by Ravi Bishnoi and Jasprit Bumrah, restricted New Zealand to 153 for 9.

description: The Met department has warned that weather conditions in Himachal Pradesh may worsen from Monday due to a fresh western disturbance, with heavy snowfall likely in higher reaches. Alerts have been issued as snowfall has already disrupted daily life, shutting over 800 roads and affecting power supply across several districts. Cold wave conditions continue in many parts of the state.

description: President Droupadi Murmu, on the Republic Day's eve, lauded India's democratic ideals, national heroes like Netaji Bose, and citizen contributions. She highlighted women's achievements, farmer's role, tribal empowerment, economic growth, and digital India's success. The address underscored collective efforts in building a stronger, self-reliant nation, inspiring national pride and unity.

description: The Trinamool Congress has strongly condemned BJP leader Sanjay Das for his derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, including calling her a "witch" and advocating for her beheading. The TMC accused the BJP of normalizing misogyny, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's past remarks and the act of handing a sword to another BJP leader during the event.

title: ‘They are stealing each other's engineers’: Yann LeCun on Google, Microsoft, Meta, OpenAI
description: AI pioneer Yann LeCun criticizes Silicon Valley's obsession with Large Language Models, calling the industry "LLM-pilled." He argues this focus stifles innovation as tech giants poach engineers, preventing diverse research. LeCun believes true artificial intelligence requires predictive "world models," a key reason for his departure from Meta to pursue this vision.

description: A college professor was fatally stabbed on a crowded Mumbai local train after a sudden argument at Malad station. CCTV footage captured the attack and helped police swiftly arrest a daily-wage labourer as the accused. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a mathematics and statistics teacher.

'Locals pulled me out of vehicle': How seat belt saved Kerala collector's life during car crash
description: Pathanamthitta District Collector Prem Krishnan S narrowly avoided serious harm when his official car overturned after a collision with a speeding private vehicle on the wrong side of the road. The Collector, his security officer, and driver sustained minor injuries, attributing their safety to wearing seat belts.

‘Injected HIV virus into doctor’: Jealous woman attacks ex-lover’s wife
description: A chilling incident in Kurnool has sparked outrage as four people, including a nurse and her young children, face serious charges after allegedly injecting a doctor with HIV-infected blood. The attack was reportedly motivated by revenge, with the victim being the ex-wife of one of the accused, who was lured into a fabricated accident as part of the sinister plot.

title: Taylor Swift’s Kelce Romance Sparks Fears Her Songwriting Is Slowing
description: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Macklin Celebrini’s becomes 12th NHL player with multiple 25-goal teen seasons
description: Macklin Celebrini’s season continues to keep getting better. At 19, he has reached another rare scoring mark, putting him among a small group of teenage players in NHL history. His growth from last season is clear, and he continues to play with confidence and consistency for the San Jose Sharks.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
description: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: ‘Doesn’t pass the sniff test’: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer for Warner Bros Discovery
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.
